data.title: 10 Dream Honeymoon Destinations & Iconic Hotels from Your Favorite Movies and TV Shows
data.meta_description: 10 Dream Honeymoon Destinations & Iconic Hotels from Your Favorite Movies and TV Shows White Lotus  Destination: Taormina, Sicily & Maui Hotel: San Domenico Palace, a Four Seasons Hotel &...
data.meta_site_name: Honeyfund Blog by Honeyfund.com, the free honeymoon registry
data.text:
White Lotus

Destination: Taormina, Sicily & Maui

Hotel: San Domenico Palace, a Four Seasons Hotel & Four Seasons Maui

San Domenico Palace, a Four Seasons Hotel in Taormina, Sicily, gained fame as a prominent filming location for the second season of “The White Lotus,” with many of the series’ luxurious and dramatic scenes set against its stunning backdrop. Nestled on a hillside with breathtaking views of the Ionian Sea and Mount Etna, Taormina offers a romantic atmosphere. Visitors can explore ancient Greek ruins, such as the stunning Teatro Antico, wander through charming medieval streets filled with boutiques and cafes, and relax on pristine beaches.

Maui, Hawaii, also featured in the TV series “The White Lotus,” offers a blend of adventure and relaxation. Known for its stunning beaches, lush landscapes, and vibrant culture, Maui provides endless opportunities for romance and exploration. Couples can enjoy activities such as snorkeling in the crystal-clear waters of Molokini Crater, driving along the scenic Road to Hana, or watching the sunrise from the summit of Haleakalā. Stay at Four Seasons Maui where the first season of “The White Lotus” was filmed from October to December 2020..

Mother of the Bride

Destination: Phuket, Thailand

Hotel: Anantara Layan Phuket Resort & Anantara Mai Khao Phuket Villas

Phuket, Thailand, as depicted in the recently released Netflix movie “Mother of the Bride,” is a spectacular honeymoon destination offering a mix of adventure, culture, and relaxation. Known for its stunning beaches, crystal-clear waters, and vibrant nightlife, Phuket is perfect for newlyweds looking for both excitement and tranquility. In “Mother of the Bride,” several picturesque scenes were filmed at the Anantara Layan Phuket Resort. These included the wedding ceremony set against the backdrop of the resort’s stunning beachfront, showcasing the pristine sands and azure waters of the Andaman Sea. Couples can explore the island’s rich culture by visiting historic temples like Wat Chalong, enjoy thrilling water sports, take romantic sunset cruises, or unwind at luxurious, yet affordable, beachfront resorts.

The Heartbreak Kid

Destination: Cocina Del Mar, Cabo San Lucas, México

Cabo San Lucas, Mexico, as highlighted in the movie “The Heartbreak Kid,” is a vibrant and picturesque honeymoon destination. Located at the southern tip of the Baja California Peninsula, Cabo is renowned for its stunning beaches, dramatic landscapes, and lively nightlife. Couples can enjoy romantic activities such as sunset cruises to the iconic Arch of Cabo San Lucas, snorkeling and diving in the clear waters of the Sea of Cortez, or exploring the charming downtown area filled with shops, restaurants, and art galleries. With its luxurious resorts, world-class dining, and an array of outdoor adventures, Cabo San Lucas offers a perfect blend of relaxation and excitement for newlyweds.

Mama Mia

Destination: Greek islands of Skopelos and Skiathos

The Greek islands of Skopelos and Skiathos, featured in the movie “Mamma Mia!,” offer an enchanting setting for a honeymoon. These islands are renowned for their crystal-clear turquoise waters, lush green landscapes, and charming white-washed buildings. Couples can explore picturesque beaches, such as Kastani Beach on Skopelos, where key scenes from the movie were filmed, or relax on the golden sands of Koukounaries Beach in Skiathos. The islands also boast delightful tavernas serving delicious Greek cuisine, scenic hiking trails, and historic sites like the Agios Ioannis Chapel.

Casino Royale

Destination: Czech Republic

Hotel: Grandhotel Pupp and Kaiserbad Spa.

The Czech Republic, the filming location for the movie “Casino Royale,” offers a captivating destination for a honeymoon. Known for its stunning architecture, rich history, and charming cities, the Czech Republic provides a perfect blend of culture and romance. Couples can explore the enchanting streets of Prague, visiting iconic landmarks such as Prague Castle, Charles Bridge, and the Astronomical Clock. The Grandhotel Pupp served as the exterior and some interior shots of the fictional Hotel Splendide in the movie, where James Bond (played by Daniel Craig) stays while participating in a high-stakes poker tournament. The country’s picturesque countryside, with its fairytale-like castles and serene landscapes, is perfect for romantic getaways.

The Sound of Music

Destination: Salzburg, Austria

Salzburg, Austria, famously depicted in the movie “The Sound of Music,” is a dreamlike destination for a honeymoon. Nestled amidst the Alps, Salzburg enchants visitors with its baroque architecture, charming old town, and breathtaking mountain views. Couples can follow in the footsteps of Maria and the von Trapp family by visiting iconic film locations such as Mirabell Gardens, Leopoldskron Palace, and Nonnberg Abbey. The city’s rich musical heritage, being the birthplace of Mozart, adds a romantic and cultural allure.

The Hangover

Destination: Las Vegas, Nevada

Hotel: Caesar’s Palace

Las Vegas, Nevada, prominently featured in the movie “The Hangover,” is an exciting and vibrant destination for a honeymoon. Known as the entertainment capital of the world, Las Vegas offers newlyweds an array of activities and experiences. Couples can enjoy world-class dining, thrilling nightlife, and spectacular shows on the famous Las Vegas Strip. Iconic attractions such as the Bellagio Fountains, the High Roller Observation Wheel, and the neon lights of Fremont Street provide endless entertainment. For a touch of romance, couples can take a gondola ride at The Venetian or explore the stunning Red Rock Canyon just outside the city. In “The Hangover,” several memorable scenes were filmed at Caesar’s Palace in Las Vegas. Key moments include the main characters checking into their lavish suite, which sets the stage for their wild bachelor party.

Crazy Rich Asians

Destination: Singapore

Hotel: Marina Bay Sands, Singapore

This vibrant city-state of Singapore, as portrayed in the movie “Crazy Rich Asians,” offers newlyweds a blend of cosmopolitan and tropical experiences. Couples can relax at the iconic Marina Bay Sands, take a romantic stroll through the futuristic Gardens by the Bay, and explore the diverse neighborhoods such as Chinatown and Little India. The city’s world-class dining scene, featuring everything from hawker centers to Michelin-starred restaurants, provides a culinary adventure. The most notable scenes in the movie filmed at the hotel Marina Bay Sands, Singapore include the lavish wedding reception held in the hotel’s stunning SkyPark, offering breathtaking panoramic views of the city skyline and the infinity pool scene where Rachel and Peik Lin discuss the challenges Rachel faces with Nick’s family.

Murder Mystery

Destination: Milan, Italy

Hotel: Principe di Savoia

Milan, Italy, as seen in Netflix’s “Murder Mystery” with Jennifer Anniston and Adam Sandler, is a sophisticated destination perfect for a honeymoon. Renowned as a global fashion and design capital, Milan offers couples a mix of culture, history, and modernity. Newlyweds can visit the magnificent Duomo di Milano, explore the world-famous art collection at the Pinacoteca di Brera, and stroll through the elegant Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II for luxury shopping. The city’s vibrant dining scene features exquisite Italian cuisine, while scenic spots like Sempione Park provide romantic settings. The Hotel Principe di Savoia serves as the luxurious setting where Nick and Audrey Spitz (played by Adam Sandler and Jennifer Aniston) stay during their European vacation.

Emily in Paris

Destination: Côte d’Azur, France

Hotel: Grand-Hôtel du Cap-Ferrat, a Four Seasons Hotel
